learning.title: Atomic Refactoring Is Critical
learning.description: Each SSOT consolidation must be atomic - complete in one operation with all references updated, legacy code deleted, and tests passing. Partial refactors create more technical debt than they solve.

learning.title: Test Mocks Must Target Canonical Implementation
learning.description: When consolidating to SSOT, all test mocks must be updated to patch the canonical location. Mocking SQLAlchemy directly bypasses SSOT and hides issues. Always mock at the service boundary.

learning.title: Microservice Independence With Shared Resources
learning.description: Auth service maintains its own managers (Redis, Database) while optionally delegating to shared managers when available. This preserves microservice independence while enabling resource sharing.

learning.title: Environment Access Must Be Centralized
learning.description: Direct os.getenv() calls violate SSOT and create configuration drift. All environment access must go through IsolatedEnvironment for consistent behavior and validation.

learning.title: Shared Configuration Reduces Duplication
learning.description: Cross-service configurations (like CORS) should live in shared/ directory to prevent duplication while maintaining service boundaries through proper delegation.
